TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SwitchLevelAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class SwitchLevelAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class SwitchLevelAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies the level type for a switch.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This attribute is intended to be applied to all classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Switch> class. The purpose of the attribute is to identify the type that specifies the switch criteria of the switch. Each switch determines whether a trace is to be written, based on whether an event type matches or exceeds the value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute.SwitchLevelType%2A> property for the switch. The type used for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute.SwitchLevelType%2A> property varies for different switches. For example, the switch level type for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch> class is <xref:System.Boolean>, and the switch level type for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type switchLevelType) cil managed

Docs.param: The that determines whether a trace should be written.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the type that determines whether a trace should be written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `switchLevelType` parameter identifies the type that is used by the switch to determine if a trace should be written; for example, the type of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch.Level%2A> property of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel>.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type that determines whether a trace should be written.
Docs.value: The that determines whether a trace should be written.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The level property of a switch is not necessarily named `Level`; for example, the level property of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch.Enabled%2A>.
## Examples The following code example displays the value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute.SwitchLevelType%2A> property for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch>.
